profileAlternative.name: Ava (Chenchen) Huang
profileAlternative.headline: Data Scientist at IBM | Quantitative Analysis
profileAlternative.summary:
Data Scientist at Chief Analytics Office, which is internal AI Center of Excellence at IBM. I am utilizing cutting edge technology to drive IBM's transformation such as NLP, Machine learning, Deep Learning and many other sophisticated analytics tools..

Master student of Operation Research program at Columbia University, with an undergraduate degree in Mathematics and Finance. Passionate about quantitative analysis and making all things possible. Creative innovator and problem-solver, eager to thrive by exploring opportunities and can learn quickly in the Company environment which fosters a culture of communication, team and hard work.

Strong quantitative skills in machine learning, NLP, deep learning, stochastic process, optimization, familiar with Python, R and SQL. Accumulated experience using statistical analysis such as multiple linear regression, machine learning algorithms implementation such as KNN and SVM, deep learning such as LSTM, Autoencoder and Tensorflow, as well as reinforcement learning during courses at Columbia.

Hands-on internship experience in quantitative research, data science and predictive modeling. Interned as Quantitative Research and Product Manager at ClimateAI in San Francisco Bay area. Researched interesting ideas to measure climate change risk and implemented models using statistical and machine learning algorithms. Worked on data organization/cleaning and feature selections to extract relationships which can be utilized by asset managers for better investment decisions and predictions.

Look forward to implementing data modeling and statistical learning methods to add quantifiable value to companies growing revenues, identifying new products/services and developing increased customer value. I take ownership of projects with high level of initiative and know how to cooperate with others very. If you have opportunities, please contact ch3294@columbia.edu.

educations.title: Columbia University in the City of New York

items: Analysis of default payments of Credit Card Clients
Reinforcement Learning for Automated Trading System
